text: I have another amazing one pot dish for
you today you're not gonna believe it
it's macaroni and cheese and everything
is cooked in the skillet including the
pasta if you're looking for over-the-top
deliciousness but all in one pot you've
come to the right place try our one pot
mac and cheese so melt your six
tablespoons of butter and then just
spoon off one tablespoon mix it in with
one cup of fresh breadcrumbs you could
use panko if you don't want to make your
own breadcrumbs to that add a quarter
cup of Parmesan cheese and then set this
aside it's gonna go on top of your mac
and cheese at the last minute and go
under the broiler I'm using a straight
sided skillet here to cook my pasta in
because I want to put it under the
broiler with the bread crumbs on top at
the end if you weren't planning on
putting the bread crumbs and you don't
care you could do this in a deeper pot
and it might actually be slightly easier
not that there's anything hard about it
it's just that you need to really stir a
lot 1/2 a cup of all-purpose flour whisk
the flour into the butter what you're
doing here is making a roux which is
gonna thicken your milk to make your
sauce this is a very big whisk and not a
very big pan so I'm gonna get the flour
out from the corners with my spoon
before you add your milk you just want
to cook your flour and butter mixture
until it smells a little bit nutty not
like nutty like wacky but like nuts that
just indicates that the flour has cooked
off and is no longer raw because this is
a little bit of a lower ratio of fat to
flour you have to be a little bit
careful when you add your milk so just
add your milk really slowly especially
in the beginning and then as it goes we
can add up a little more quickly I'm
just gonna add some this down and whisk
every time you add the milk it might
just get a little bit lumpy you just
want to whisk it out until the lumps go
away honestly if you had a friend
standing by the best thing that you
could do is have your friend at
the milk and you keep whisking sometimes
what I like to do in order to cut back
on fat is do a combination of milk and
chicken stock I'm not doing that today
but if you're not a vegetarian you can
do that in fact you could use vegetable
stock too you want to make sure when
milk comes to a boil that it doesn't
boil over so keep an eye on it then once
it's at a boil you can add your pasta
3/4 of a pound of elbow macaroni I'm
gonna approximate then you just cook
this until the pasta is done and that
really only takes about 6 minutes make
sure when you're stirring that you're
getting to the bottom of the pan because
you have to be careful that your pasta
and/or your sauce doesn't stick so when
you're starting don't just dip your
spoon in go all the way down to the
bottom turn the heat off when the pasta
is done if it's just slightly less than
completely done that's okay because it's
gonna continue cooking in the heat and
also go under the broiler add your
cheese I have 3 cups of grated Gouda
it's a lot of cheese and one cup of
Gruyere Gruyere gives classic delicious
flavor and it's so good with the bacon
you want to just let that melt in a
little bit this is gonna kill you
but you're gonna be so happy while it's
happening oh my god it's so cheesy and
delicious this is our ultra deluxe

almost forgot the bacon and the Dijon it
gets a teaspoon of Dijon mustard and
then there's eight strips of bacon
cooked and crumbled in you don't really
want to walk away from this to start

this pan eight pieces of bacon cuz we're
making a bacon mac and cheese version
make sure your Bacon's nice and crisp
and cook it in this pan before you start
doing anything else
season it with salt need some salt of
course and some pepper sprinkle the
breadcrumbs on top and then pop it into
